meanings.definition: The act of overcasting the raw edges of a fabric to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to do serging in my sewing class.
meanings.sent2: She used serging to make sure the fabric edges didn't unravel.
meanings.sent3: The magical serging kept the fabric from turning into a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her serging was like a protective shield for the fabric's edges.
meanings.sent5: The neat serging made the fabric look professional and tidy.

meanings.definition: A type of stitch used in sewing to create a finished edge.
meanings.sent1: My favorite stitch to use is serging because it looks so clean.
meanings.sent2: The serging along the hem of the dress was perfectly done.
meanings.sent3: The serging stitch danced along the fabric, adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: Her serging stitch was like a frame, highlighting the edge of the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The serging stitch neatly wrapped around the fabric, giving it a polished look.

meanings.definition: The process of finishing a fabric edge with a serger machine.
meanings.sent1: I watched a tutorial on YouTube to learn more about serging with a serger machine.
meanings.sent2: The serging process made the fabric edge look professional and clean.
meanings.sent3: The serging with the serger machine was like magic, transforming the fabric edge.
meanings.sent4: Her serging with the serger machine was as precise as a robot's work.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the serger machine doing the serging was oddly satisfying.
